title: Keep timers running across tab switches, update button color, and add Reminders tab

requirements.text: Ensure each timer (Pomodoro, Stopwatch, Countdown, Interval, Repeating) continues running correctly when the user switches to a different timer tab and then switches back, without pausing, resetting, or losing elapsed/remaining time due to component unmounting/remounting.

quotes: make the timers work even if I click on another one, in the tab.

acceptanceCriteria: Start any timer and confirm it is running.
Switch to a different timer tab; the previously running timer continues progressing in the background (its internal time keeps updating).
Switch back to the original timer tab; its displayed time reflects the correct elapsed/remaining time (no reset, no unexpected pause).
This behavior works for all timer modes: Pomodoro, Stopwatch, Countdown, Interval, Repeating.

requirements.text: Update the primary button styling so buttons use hex color #9E1C37 as the primary (default) button background color across the app (including light/dark themes), without editing files under the read-only `frontend/src/components/ui` path.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary/action buttons render with background color #9E1C37 (verified via computed styles in the browser).
Button text remains readable with sufficient contrast.
No changes are made to any files in `frontend/src/components/ui`.

requirements.text: Add a new top-level "Reminders" tab/section to the main app navigation alongside the existing timer tabs, and implement a basic reminders UI that lets users create, view, edit, and delete reminders stored locally in the browser.

quotes: add a reminder tab in the website

acceptanceCriteria: The main tab bar includes a "Reminders" tab that switches to a Reminders view.
Users can add a reminder with at least: title (text) and due date/time.
Users can edit and delete existing reminders.
Reminders persist across page reloads using localStorage.

requirements.text: Add a small, timer-adjacent enhancement in response to "what else can you add?": provide an optional, user-toggleable end-of-timer alert that triggers when a timer completes (e.g., in-app dialog/toast and/or a short sound), implemented entirely client-side.

quotes: and what else can you add?

acceptanceCriteria: There is a user-facing toggle in Settings to enable/disable end-of-timer alerts.
When enabled, completing a Countdown/Pomodoro segment/Interval cycle end/Repeating completion triggers an alert experience in the UI.
When disabled, no alert is shown/played on completion.
Implementation does not require backend changes or external services.

constraints: Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose them instead).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in `backend/main.mo`; only add backend logic if strictly necessary for the requested features.
No external databases or third-party auth providers; local persistence should use browser storage where appropriate.
nonGoals: Push notifications, SMS/email reminders, or any external messaging integration.
